intro: Fadogia cienkowskii, commonly known as the African velvet tamarind, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in open woodlands and savannas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
